Judul: GREEN ARCHITECTURE PARADIGM: FROM URBAN UTOPIA TO MODERN METHODS OF QUALITY ASSESSMENT
Abstrak:
Trends of environmental, social and economic development in the modem world are driving forward the theory and
practice of Green Building with important role for architecture and architects. The article presents a comprehensive analysis
of the Green Building doctrine and its historic background based on a review of main ideas of Green Architecture including its
historic roots, as well as modem theories and practices of contemporary system of sustainabiiity. Complex quality assessment
methodologies developed in different regions of the world to evaluate environmental, social, economic and creative features of
new and renovated buildings and urban complexes are analyzed in order to identify the most effective and advanced tools and
methods. The importance of sustainabiiity aspects is presented by a comparative analysis of basic features of building's quality
assessment methods originated in different countries and regions, as it reveals the structure and weight impact of different
evaluation methods. The article also addresses the impact of Green Architecture theories and assessment methods on architectural
practice by analyzing outstanding case studies in urban design, landscape architecture and volumetric building design.
Kata Kunci: Architecture, green urbanism, quality assessment methodology, landscape architecture, sustainable buildings.
